subject: Productivity
title: Pre-Mortem Analysis
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Pre-Mortem Analysis.

hook.text: Imagine your project has already failed. Now work backward to figure out why. That's a pre-mortem.

buildup.text: Gary Klein developed this technique. It flips optimism into productive paranoia.

discovery.text: Research shows pre-mortems increase the ability to identify risks by 30% compared to standard planning.

twist.text: It also gives permission to voice doubts. In normal planning, criticism feels disloyal.

climax.text: The best time to find a fatal flaw is before you launch, not after the wreckage.

punchline.text: Plan for failure before it plans for you.

quiz.question: What is a pre-mortem analysis?
options: Imagining a project has failed and working backward to find causes
Reviewing a project after it has actually failed
Celebrating success before a project launches
